p: The aqueous leaf extract of Oenothera biennis contains phenolic compounds (e.g., ellagitannins and caffeoyl tartaric acid) and flavonoids (quercetin glucuronide and kaempferol glucuronide) [ 3]. Among the tannins contained in the leaves of the evening primrose are oenothein A and oenothein B. The carbohydrates present in the extracts include arabinose, galactose, glucose, mannose, galacturonic acid, and glucuronic acid.
